The paper discusses approximation thresholds for combinatorial optimization problems, which are typically studied in computer science sub-fields such as algorithms and complexity theory. Based on the abstract, the paper likely falls under the category of "Discrete Mathematics" (cs.DM) as it deals with combinatorial optimization problems. However, it also involves algorithmic and computational aspects, which could place it in categories such as "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS), "Computational Complexity" (cs.CC), "Computational Geometry" (cs.CG), and "Game Theory" (cs.GT).
